707644f-a.text:
First Ave., east side, south from East 6lst., to and including 6Oth Streets. Shown in the background, (60th Street), is the ramp and approach
of the Oueensboro Bridge.
June 16, 1936.
P. L. Sperr.

707643f-a.text:
First Aoenue, east side, north from E. 60th Street. At the right is a gasoline station (detailed in view 2) at the N. E. corner. Above same are the gas holders on
York Avenue.
August 1, 1939
Views 1,2
P. L. Sperr

714057f-b.text:
E. 60th Street, at and eaat ofthe N.E. corner of First Avenue. Shown are old tenements being torn down for new apartment house development. View 1 shows Nos. 403 to 417 E. 60th Street, where a new apartment house was later put up, seen on the right in view 2. View 2 shows No. 401 E. 60th Street (rirht), a corner tenement and Nos. 1104-1108 First Avenue (left), which are also coming down.

P. L. Sperr  View 1: August 5, 1929
NO REPRODUCTIONS  View 2: Sept. 25, 1935
